itemDescription: British merchant in the textile industry

wikipedia_page.main: James Hodgson  (c. 1790 – 1870) was a British merchant in the textile industry, co-founder of Hodgson, Robinson & Co.  He maintained commercial ties with Buenos Aires in times of Juan Manuel de Rosas.

response: *James Hodgson (cricketer, born 1969), headmaster of Bedford School and English cricketer
*James Hodgson (mathematician) (1672–1755), English mathematical teacher, lecturer and writer

John Robinson was an English merchant, partner of James Hodgson in the textile company Hodgson & Robinson. His company operated in Montevideo and Buenos Aires from 1838 to 1842, and in Brazil in 1838.
